bleeding and that's a different view of an architect than what we've had in the past some would argue that architecture
is about designing beautiful buildings or creating monuments or spaces that speak about the ideas of the designer
architecture has often times been about mimicking a particular style with little regard to the culture or the people in
which it is placed Jan wamper recognizes some of the shortcomings of this Nar view of architecture Jan uses his Studio
as a way of teaching students that the purpose of Architecture is not only to design beautiful spaces but to design
these spaces while remembering the people the history of the place the color and the
music then architecture becomes a process of embracing what is there and transforming it into something new and
useful without discarding the old it's about creating spaces for the community
those who will live and work in these places it's about understanding and working with the people to co-create

space Jan Wampler is a professor of architecture in the School of Architecture and planning at MIT Jan has
been teaching architecture to both graduate and undergraduate students at MIT for almost 30 years Jan not only
teaches but he is also a practicing architect with his own private projects these projects range from something as
small as the design of a stained glass window to elaborate multif family housing projects combining teaching and
practice allows Jan to help students understand what being a successful architect means finding projects that
help students understand the multi-dimensional aspects of this new understanding of architecture can be
difficult a site must offer a challenge to a student in terms of size structure
charm community and Beauty yet at the same time these site challenges can't
overwhelm the student also the site needs to be manageable so that the students who only
have a limited time to visit the site can survey the buildings talk to the people and absorb the culture in a few
days time for his spring 2004 Studio Jan chose a site located in Cuba a country
off limits to US citizens who do not have business or academic interests in the country Jan chose to work in Cuba
because of its Rich architectural history that has been preserved as a result of the US embargo against Cuba
Jan had to secure a license from the US government to travel to Cuba with students and Jan had to find local
Architects to work with in the area the site Jan chose is valat Cuba an

unlike the old city vat has some of the most dilapitated housing in the vicinity

1959 shortly after Castro's rise to power relations with the United States began to deteriorate Castro nationalized
